intro: Pityrodia lepidota var. verticillata, commonly known as the clustered pincushion bush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for native gardens. It plays a role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds.
